description: This recipe from the late chef Charlie Trotter came to The Times in 2001 as part of a story about the raw food movement, in which every element of every dish is raw, organic and vegan If you do not have a juicer, buy carrot juice instead.
title: Chilled Burgundy Carrot Soup with Celery, Belgian Endive and Baby Golden Beets
title_page: Chilled Burgundy Carrot Soup with Celery, Belgian Endive and Baby Golden Beets Recipe - NYT Cooking
text:
This recipe from the late chef Charlie Trotter came to The Times in 2001 as part of a story about the raw food movement, in which every element of every dish is raw, organic and vegan. If you do not have a juicer, buy carrot juice instead.
Featured in: Raw Sophistication: The Great Cooks Discover Noncooking.
